proverb: Nnụnụ benyere n'ọdụ igu na-achọ egwu ọ ga-agba
interpretation: The bird that perches on a fence is looking for a dance to dance

proverb: Nwa mgbada gbajiri ụkwụ ya n'egwu tupu oge eji agba egwu eruo
interpretation: The deer already dances itself to a broken waist before the time to dance arrives

proverb: A na-egwu egwu na ebisa aka na ikpu, ndị nwụrụ anwụ a na-alọ ụwa
interpretation: When you are playing with hands to the vagina: the spirits are returning to the world

proverb: Onwekwara egwu ezi na-agaghị agba?
interpretation: Is there a music that cannot be danced to

proverb: Agadi nwaanyị anaghị aka nka n'egwu ọ ma agba
interpretation: An old woman cannot forget the dance step she knows how to dance.

proverb: Atụrụ sị na a kụrụ egwu ruo na be ya, ọ bụrụ na ọ maghị agba, ọ wụliwe elu
interpretation: The sheep said that in as much as it does not know how to dance, if musicians pass in front of its fathers house and it does not know what to do, it will start jumping.

proverb: Chi nyere nwa ogbenye ji ga-enye ya mbazụ ọ ga-eji egwuru ya
interpretation: God who gives yam to a poor man will give the field where he will grow it

proverb: Egwuru egwu nwa nkịta na nwa nkịta bụ onye daara ibe ya ibe ya daara y’a
interpretation: The play of dogs is that one falls down for the other

proverb: Onye nwanne ya na-amaghị agba egwu na-akọ ụkọ nku anya
interpretation: A person whose siblings don't know how to dance, begins to talk about scratching their eyes.

proverb: Nwaanyị na-amụ nwa na-eti mkpu bu ụmụagbọbia ka ọ na-eyi egwu
interpretation: A woman who's screaming while giving birth, puts fear in the minds of young women.

proverb: Uzu na-amaghi akpu ogene lee egbe anya n'odu.
interpretation: The blacksmith who does know how to forge a metal gong should look at the tail of a kite

proverb: Mkpume rịgoro elu, egwu atụwa ite mmiri
interpretation: When a stone gets up, water pot gets frightened

proverb: Onye n’ egwu egwu nwa okuko n'ete akpala ya
interpretation: He who dances the dance of the chicken

proverb: O dighi mma a gbachaa egwu ka nwoke, e bie ya ka nwanyi.
interpretation: It is not good to start dancing like a man and end like a woman

proverb: Ejighi akwa ebitere ebite agbasi egwu ike.
interpretation: You do not dance energetically when wearing borrowed clothes

proverb: Okuku bere na ngige, ngige egwu okuku egwu
interpretation: A bird perches on the branch, the bird dances as the branch dances

proverb: Eze mbe si na ihe ya ji-achiri ihe-egwu ya aga njem bu maka ya ezu ndiegwu.
interpretation: The tortoise said that it always travels with its musical instrument in case it meets other musicians

proverb: Atulu si na o bu eziokwu na o maghi agba egwu ma akuru egwu gafeta n’ama nna ya, o maghi ihe o ga-eme, o wulibe elu
interpretation: The sheep said that in as much as it does not know how to dance, if musicians pass in front of its fathers house and it does not know what to do, it will start jumping

proverb: Egwu uwa wu egwu okoso
interpretation: The dance of the world is the dance of the okoso

proverb: Nwata na agba egwu surugede amaghi na egwu surugede bu egwu nde mmuo
interpretation: The child that dances surugede music/dance does not know that surugede music/dance is a dance/music of the spirits

proverb: O bu naani onye enweghi nwanne na-anya akpa agba egwu
interpretation: It is a person who has no relative that can be seen carrying their bag while dancing

proverb: Uwa bu egwu, onye o daalu o gbaba
interpretation: The world is a moving musical cavalcade, if the tunes come your way, you dance along

proverb: Uwa bu ijele mmonwu, akwuro ofu ebe enene ya
interpretation: The world is a dancing masquerade, you can’t appreciate its entirety from a single view or fixed point

proverb: A gbacha egwu, ọ laa n'ukwu
interpretation: The end of a dance is on the waist

proverb: A kubie egwu, onye ntị ike ana-agba
interpretation: When the music stops, a deaf person continues to dance

proverb: Egwu ebidobeghi, mgbada agbajigo ukwu rịị:
interpretation: The deer has broken its legs before the dance even began

proverb: Nshịkọ sị egwuruegwu rue nke ịchịfe aka azụ, onye egwusala ya
interpretation: The crab says that when play gets to the point of pulling its hand backward, no-one should play with it

proverb: Nwa nnụnụ na-agba egwu n'akwa nduru, nwere ihe na-akụrụ ya egwu n'ime ọhịa:
interpretation: When a bird dances in the middle of the road, something inside the bush is playing the music for it

proverb: Ọ bụghị egwu achị ụtaba n'aka agba:
interpretation: Not every dance is performed with tobacco/snuff in hand

proverb: Agadi nwaanyi a naghi aka nka na egwu o mara agba
interpretation: An old woman cannot forget the dance step she knows how to dance

proverb: Ọchịcha di njikere igba egwu, ma ọkụkọ hụrụ ya ka nwakpo ezi
interpretation: The cockroach was ready to dance but as for the fowl, who regarded its movement as a violation of territorial integrity

proverb: Enwe si na otu unere si atu ya egwu ka ya si kwa atu unere egwu
interpretation: The monkey says he is as scared of bananas as bananas are scared of him

proverb: Dike anaghị atụ egwu ọdụm
interpretation: A brave person does not fear the lion

proverb: Agụ anaghị atụ egwu ọgịrịga
interpretation: A leopard does not fear a whistle

proverb: Nwata kọrọ egwu agaghị amụcha ụkwụ egwu.
interpretation: A child who learns to dance will not lack dancing steps

proverb: A na-aga egwu ọnwa ka ahụ mmadụ ọ bụghị ka ahụ ọnwa, maka ọnwa na-eti n'ụlọ onye ọbụla
interpretation: We go to the dance to meet people, not to watch the moon

proverb: Egwu anaghị atụ afọ, o buru ụzọ
interpretation: Fear does not affect the stomach, that’s why it is always in front.

proverb: Nwa nnụnụ anaghị eso nne ya agba egwu
interpretation: A bird’s chick does not dance with its mother

proverb: Uwa di egwu
interpretation: The world is wonderful

proverb:
Nwata nwere ike were ara nne ya gwue egwu ma aka ya
agaghị eru n’amụ nna ya
interpretation: A child can play with its mother's breasts but not with the father's testicles

proverb: Onye mkpumkpu na aga ikiri egwu n'oge
interpretation: A short person will always be punctual to watch a dance

proverb: E bugharia egwu, e bugharia onodu
interpretation: Whenever the dancing position changes, the watching position also changes

proverb: Onye nwanne ya na agba ajo egwu nadi na ako oko n'iku anya
interpretation: He whose sister is not dancing well is always scratching his eye lids

proverb: Oke soru Ngwere egwu-mmiri, o koo Ngwere, n'ogaghi ako Oke
interpretation: If a rat goes swimming with a lizard, the lizard gets dry but the rat stays wet

proverb: Oke egwuregwu n'ebute mkpari
interpretation: Familiarity breeds contempt

proverb: Nsuko ga egwu orimiri ukwu na nke nta, mana ite ofe nwa agadi nwayi ga eri ya
interpretation: The crab may swim across big and small rivers but it will eventually end up in an old woman's soup pot.

proverb: Nnukwu mmanwu na agba egwu, oti mkpu ga eti ri ri!
interpretation: when the great masquerade dances, the henchmen will surely hola!

proverb: Ikwuikwui nyuru aru si umu nna ya kwere ya egwu. ha si ya tufuakwa, na anaghi ekwere ihe ojoo egwu
interpretation: If you deform yourself — morally or otherwise — don’t expect others to celebrate you.
